items.question: Is this a one-time payment or a recurring subscription?
items.answer: Editor Collab hosting is a one-time payment for a level slot you can share any level in. To share another level, just [stop sharing your current level](How do I stop hosting a level?), and the slot will be freed.

items.question: Which payment methods are accepted?
items.answer: Currently, payments from [Stripe](https://buy.stripe.com/aEUbLb38R2Cw91K9AA) and [Ko-Fi](https://ko-fi.com/alk1m123) are accepted. If you decide to get it using Ko-Fi, please [reach out to us](/contact) so we can provide you with the key.

items.question: What happens when I buy it?
items.answer: Stripe will automatically provide you with a 16-letter key upon purchase. For Ko-Fi, please [reach out](/contact) so we can provide you with the key.

items.question: How do I activate hosting after payment?
items.answer: To use the key, press the "Local Levels" tab, press "View" on a local level, and press the "Edit" button at the center left. You will see a new button appear at the top right of the screen. Press the "Share" button at the top right that has appeared, and it will open a popup you can enter your key in. Enter your key into the box labelled with "XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX", and press the "Activate" button. Now you can host your own level!

items.question: Can I gift a hosting key to someone else?
items.answer: Yes, just give the activation key you have received to anyone you want to give it to.

items.question: Is there a free trial for hosting?
items.answer: Currently no, but if you join our [Discord Server](https://discord.gg/GFMnMMkpBq) and go to the [#share-level channel](https://discord.com/channels/1210938938286669924/1210940329696694272) people would be glad to invite you to their own levels for you to try out!

items.question: Do hosting payments include updates or future versions of the mod?
items.answer: The hosting payment includes every update and future versions of Editor Collab.

items.question: Can I transfer my hosting access to another account?
items.answer: If you want to transfer your hosting access please [reach out to us](/contact).

items.question: Can I host on multiple devices?
items.answer: Your hosting access is tied to your Geometry Dash account, so you can host your level anywhere you can as long as you log into your Geometry Dash account.

items.question: What happens if my payment fails or is declined?
items.answer: Our payment providers may decline some payments, in which case you should try a different payment system.

items.question: Can I get a refund if I'm not satisfied?
items.answer: We have a 14-day change-of-mind period, with a requirement for a valid reason for anything outside that period. For the full refund policy please see our [Refund Policy](/legal/refund-policy).

items.question: Is my payment info stored safely?
items.answer: We as Editor Collab only store your mail info safely to send you necessary information about Editor Collab, otherwise we do not store any info about your payment details in our servers, and your name and address are stored safely in our payment providers.

items.question: What is Editor Collab?
items.answer: Editor Collab is a live multiplayer editor collaboration tool designed for all kinds of people from casual creators to megacollab hosts. While being one of its kind, Editor Collab provides you with all the functionality you would expect from a multiplayer editor tool. Just press the "Editor Collab" button and ask your friend to invite you and collab!

items.question: What do I need before installing?
items.answer: You need the latest Geometry Dash version and [Geode](https://geode-sdk.org) which can be installed at geode-sdk.org. You also need a Geometry Dash account as Editor Collab uses your Geometry Dash account to synchronize data.

items.question: Does it work on Windows/MacOS/Linux/Android/iOS?
items.answer: Editor Collab is available on every platform Geode supports, meaning it supports Windows, MacOS, Linux, Android and iOS.

items.question: Does everyone in the collab need the mod installed?
items.answer: Yes, everyone you want to invite into your Editor Collab level needs to have the mod installed.

items.question: How do I install Editor Collab using Geode?
items.answer: After installing [Geode](https://geode-sdk.org), open Geometry Dash and press the "Geode" button to open the Geode menu. Open the "Download" tab and search for "Editor Collab", and download the mod named "Editor Collab". After confirming the download, you need to restart your game. After the restart, press the "Creator" button on the center right of the screen, and press the "Create" button at the top left. If you have the Editor Collab button on the bottom left, you have installed it successfully.

items.question: How do I update the mod?
items.answer: You can update the mod using the Geode menu. Press the "Geode" button on the main menu, press on the "Update" button with the two circular arrows pointing to each other. After it downloads, you can restart your game, and the mod will be updated.

items.question: How do I uninstall it safely?
items.answer: You can uninstall the mod using the Geode menu. Press the "Geode" button on the main menu, find the mod named "Editor Collab" in the installed tab, and press the "View" button. In the manage section at the bottom left, there should be an "Uninstall" button, which you can press to uninstall the mod.

items.question: How do I log into Editor Collab?
items.answer: First, [install Editor Collab](How do I install Editor Collab using Geode?) if you haven't already. Then, open Geometry Dash, press the "Creator" button at the center right, and press the "Create" button at the top left. Press the "Editor Collab" button at the bottom left, and when the button turns colored it means that you are logged into the Editor Collab servers.

items.question: How do I host a level?
items.answer: After [activating hosting](How do I activate hosting after payment?), when you press the "Share" button, you will see a popup where you can share your level. You can press the "Start Sharing" button to start sharing your level in Editor Collab servers.

items.question: How do I share my level with others?
items.answer: To invite others to your level, press the "Share" button in the editor. In the popup, there is a text box where you can type usernames. Add the Geometry Dash usernames of the people you want to invite and press the "Add" button to invite them to the list below. In the list below, you can select the role you want to assign to them (Viewer, Editor, Admin), or remove them from the list if you don't want to share with that account.

items.question: What are the different roles (Viewer, Editor, Admin)?
items.answer:
- Viewer: Can view the level and make local changes, but changes won't be shared.
- Editor: Can view and edit the level, and changes will be shared with everyone.
- Admin: In addition to Editor permissions, can invite other people as "Editor" or "Viewer".

items.question: How do I join levels shared with me?
items.answer: [Log into Editor Collab](How do I log into Editor Collab?), go to the "Shared w Me" tab, find the level in the list, press "View", and press the "Edit" button to join.

items.question: How many players can join at once?
items.answer: Currently in Early Access, there is a hard limit of 20 admins, 20 editors, and 20 viewers, with plans to increase this in the future.

items.question: What happens if the host leaves?
items.answer: The level will keep shared until the host decides to stop sharing. All invited persons can freely join and leave even if the host is not online.

items.question: How can I join back to my hosted level?
items.answer: [Log into Editor Collab](How do I log into Editor Collab?), go to the "My Levels" tab, find your hosted level, press "View", and press the "Edit" button.

items.question: How do I stop hosting a level?
items.answer: Press the "Share" button in the editor, and press the "Stop Sharing" button in the popup. This will save a copy of the level to your Local Levels and free up your level slot.

items.question: Are the hosted levels private?
items.answer: Yes. Only people you have shared with can access the levels. No one can access your hosted levels without being invited by a host or an admin.

items.question: Where can I find the list of people in the level?
items.answer: When you pause in the editor, press the "Accounts" button at the bottom (with a user icon) to access the list of users currently in the level.

items.question: Can I kick someone from a session?
items.answer: Open the user list, find the user you want to kick, and press the "X" button. You can optionally provide a reason for the kick.

items.question: Can the host restrict what others can edit?
items.answer: Currently not supported, but support is planned for limiting editors to specific X/Y Positions, Editor Layers, Group IDs, Color Channels, and Item/Block IDs.

items.question: How does saving work in a collab session?
items.answer: Every action inside the level is stored safely in Editor Collab servers. Even if you crash or close the game, the actions will be saved and not lost.

items.question: Can I save my level to my local levels?
items.answer: Yes. Join a level, open the editor pause menu, and press the "Save to Local" button, which creates a local copy accessible in your "Local Levels" tab.

items.question: Is there a backup system?
items.answer: Not yet, but BetterEdit level backup integration is planned. In the meantime, you can [save to local](Can I save my level to my local levels?) to make backups.

items.question: What if someone disconnects?
items.answer: Editor Collab will try to reconnect them. If it fails, the user will be kicked and can try to rejoin. Actions will not be lost.

items.question: How can I see other people playtesting?
items.answer: Editor Collab shows selection boxes tied to usernames to show what objects someone has selected. It also has integration with Globed, allowing others to see everyone playtesting while editing.

items.question: Will this increase lag in large levels?
items.answer: In Early Access, Editor Collab has notable overhead. Performance improvements are planned, but for now the maximum object count is limited to 40k objects.

items.question: Is there delay between players?
items.answer: There are some delays: one from Editor Collab buffering sequential actions, and another from server communication latency.

items.question: Does it work with other Geode mods?
items.answer: Editor Collab should work with most non-editor mods and some editor mods. A known incompatibility is Named Editor Groups. [Contact the team](/contact) to request support for a specific mod.

items.question: Are there known desync issues?
items.answer: Yes, some desync issues exist in Early Access. They are generally not reproducible, making them hard to fix. The main goal of Early Access is to eliminate all desync issues. Please [report any you encounter](/contact).

items.question: I can't exit playtesting, what happened?
items.answer: Editor Collab disables exiting during a playtest to avoid premature disconnection. A popup will ask you to confirm disconnection. You can also exit safely via the "Exit" button in the editor pause menu.

items.question: When I try to share a level, it says I need to pay again, what happened?
items.answer: Check if you have an actively shared level in the "My Levels" tab. You may need to [stop sharing that level](How do I stop hosting a level?) first. If you recently changed usernames, try "Refresh Login" in Geometry Dash's account manager. [Contact support](/contact) if the issue persists.

items.question: Some objects seem desynced, what can I do?
items.answer: Take frequent backups by [saving to local](Can I save my level to my local levels?). When you detect desync, [save your level](Can I save my level to my local levels?), [stop sharing](How do I stop hosting a level?), and share it again.

items.question: I crash when I try to open the hosted level, what can I do?
items.answer: Enable the "Enable Crash Recovery" setting in the Editor Collab mod settings (Geode menu > Editor Collab > Settings). Join the level, let it crash, reopen the game, and rejoin. [Save your level](Can I save my level to my local levels?), [stop sharing](How do I stop hosting a level?), and share again. Disable "Enable Crash Recovery" afterward as it can cause unintended issues. [Contact support](/contact) if the problem persists.

items.question: It joins me into the editor but I can't click anything, why?
items.answer: Editor Collab needs time to load actions from servers after opening the editor. If it takes too long, [save your level](Can I save my level to my local levels?), [stop sharing](How do I stop hosting a level?), and share it again. [Contact support](/contact) if the issue persists.

items.question: I am getting reconnection errors when entering, what can I do?
items.answer: Some internet providers may block WebSockets used by Editor Collab. Try connecting via mobile hotspot, a VPN, or a different Wi-Fi. [Contact support](/contact) if it still doesn't work.

items.question: It doesn't seem to work with this mod, what can I do?
items.answer: If you found an incompatible mod, please [contact the Editor Collab team](/contact).
